step_of_the_day.title:
The healthy way to let go of mistakes and your feelings toward yourself. You can be angry with yourself
            without putting yourself down (Pillars #1, 6, & 9)
step_of_the_day.content:
Personal growth is dependent on how you treat yourself and how you handle your mistakes. If you are afraid
            to make a mistake or ready to put yourself down for not doing it perfectly, you will tend to avoid and
            procrastinate.You want to approach life, and getting things done from a positive place as well as the awareness that when
            you try new endeavors, you are bound to make mistakes in the learning process. If you are accepting of this
            fact you will be less averse to trying new things. Yogi got it half right: avoiding being angry with
            himself. At the same time, it’s important to take responsibility for a mistake, so you can make adjustments
            to get it right.

action_step:
If you have been upset or angry with yourself for a mistake, follow this process to let go and move on: a.
            express this anger without putting yourself down, without calling yourself any names (such as “you’re
            stupid). In other words, don’t undermine yourself, simply express the anger so you can let go, b. If you
            made a mistake that had a cost, find a benefit to balance this out. The benefit would be the lesson learned
            that makes you more likely to do better the next time. c. Forgive and be accepting of yourself, reminding
            yourself that you are not perfect and that it’s okay to make a mistake as long as you do your best and are
            learning and trying to do better, d. move forward and take action.
